Articles.Content: I seem to have a problem with recovering my vessel after landing. I just started playing and after having sent up 5-6 rockets I can no longer recover the vessel once landed. They are unharmed and I have even tried doing an EVA once landed, but everytime I attempt to recover or return to spacecenter I get the message "No Target". Does anybody know how to fix this?

you prob should have looked at the thread telling you what to include in this sub forum.

without logs, pics or reproduction step we cant tell what is wrong I guess your playin stock scince you posted here.

Im guessing you can return to space centre?

Your best bet is to just restart KSP.

Oh and Welcome to the forums.

Thank you.

Yeah I just started playing yesterday and I saw the post after making this post. And I can't do anything once this error occurs and restarting just means I get the error the next time I land. But I think I will try and make a proper post once I have some time to read through the instructions on how to see my log. But thank you for replying.

No worries. Since you are using windows, the log file in your case will be in KSP_Data\output_log.txt. Also, I've linked the thread below. It will also tell you how to take screenshots and such. I would say in your case, a log file, a screen shot, and a description of how you are trying to recover will be best.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/92230-%21%21%21-PLEASE-READ-BEFORE-POSTING-%21%21%21-Stock-Support-Bug-Reporting-Guide

Welcome to the forums!

Cheers,

~Claw
